info.title: Regionalised and Domain-specific Taxon Lists
info.description:
The DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists is part of a Diversity Workbench (DWB) services network. It is delivering basic information on taxon names in use, synonyms, classification and German vernacular names of a number of groups of animals, fungi and plants.

The current focus is on domain-specific lists (checklists, taxon reference lists, red lists) from Germany under active curation by experts on taxonomy or floristics and faunistics. Each regionalised and domain-specific taxon list has its own history and objectives, is managed completely separately and has its own hierarchical classification. The DiversityTaxonNames (DTN) data resources accessed by the REST API may include additional taxon-related data useful, e. g., for regional nature conservation agencies and environmental projects.


For more information please check How to use the DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists and Overview on Published Lists. For content details see DTN Taxon Lists Services.

Der DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists ist Teil eines Netzwerkes aus Diversity Workbench (DWB) Diensten. Er liefert Basisinformation zu anerkannten Taxonnamen, Synonymen, Klassifikationen und deutsche Volksnamen für eine Anzahl von Tier-, Pilz- und Pflanzengruppen.

Der Fokus liegt dabei zur Zeit auf domän-spezifischen Listen (Checklisten, Taxonreferenzlisten und Rote Listen) aus Deutschland, die von taxonomisch oder floristisch bzw. faunistisch arbeitenden Experten aktiv kuratiert werden. Jede regionalisierte und domän-spezifische Taxonliste hat ihre eigene Geschichte und Zielvorstellungen, wird separat gemanagt und hat eine eigenständige hierarchische Klassifikation. Die über die REST API zugänglichen DiversityTaxonNames (DTN) Datenquellen können weitere taxon-bezogene Daten enthalten, die für regionale Naturschutzeinrichtungen und Umweltprojekte von Bedeutung sein können.


Hinweise zum Einsatz der REST API finden sich unter How to use the DWB REST Webservice for Taxon Lists. Die derzeit veröffentlichten Listen werden in einer Übersicht angezeigt. Weitere Information zum Inhalt stehen unter DTN Taxon Lists Services.

REST API Documentation

get.description:
Full text search on names

The search covers the fields:

  • TaxonNameCache
  • CommonName
  • CountryCode
  • DatabaseName

Use ~N to allow N uncertain letters: colo~2 will search everything by exchanging two letters in colo: colo, coco, cora, ...

Additional search possiblities with:

  • Search for NameID with the parameter nameid.
  • Search for exact matches in attribute TaxonNameCache with parameter exactname.

      • Parameters should not be used together in one query. One parameter has to be given..

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Text to search

parameters.name: exactname
parameters.description: Exact name to search in field TaxonNameCache

parameters.name: nameid
parameters.description: NameID to search for in all lists

parameters.name: exactnamepartwithoutauthorandyear
parameters.description: Search only for the first part of a name without authors and year. Only exact matches are returned.

200.description: An list of usrls to the name specifications

get.summary: link to all list items with the given analysis category
get.description:
A list with all list items associated with this analysis id, optinal limiting query parameters can be provided.

The parameters can limit the resultset to a specific TaxonNameListReferenceID which is otherwise ignored.

The operator and the value parameters represents simple SQL-like result limiting possiblity

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: listid
parameters.description: database unique id of the list

parameters.name: analysisid
parameters.description: database unique id of the analysis category

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: analysis value to seach for

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: comparison operator for the seach (eq, lt, gt, le, ge, ne, like, notlike)

parameters.name: refid
parameters.description: optional reference id to limit the results to a specific TaxonNameListReferenceID

200.description: An array listing all list items having a analysis value assignd in that analysis categroy

get.summary: link to the analysis cetegories in this list which indirectly have a reference to the given referenceid
get.description:
Returns all analysis categories which (indirectly) have a link to the given referenceid.

This means that a parent analysis categorie might be pointing to this referenceid or to a child of this referenceid.

Example: All analysis categories which indirectly refrencing the given Rote Liste publications.

This indirection over two hierarchies was necessary as normaly only a parent analysis categorie is linked to a referenceid and those referenceids are normaly only books of a series. With this implementation all analysis categories of a complete series of books for this list can be retrieved.

parameters.name: database
parameters.description: database name

parameters.name: listid
parameters.description: database unique id of the list

parameters.name: referenceid
parameters.description: database unique id of the reference

200.description: An array with analysis category definitions and links to optional parent and child analysis categories and to optional defined nominal analysis values for this analysis category

get.description: Links to all projects on this server. Not implemented.

get.summary: links to the external name services
get.description: get a list of links to external name services. These can be webservices or simple websites with the possibility to link directly to taxonomic name information

parameters.description: database unique id of the external source

200.description: An array with which contains information and links list to external name sources

url.description: Link/url to the found taxonomic name

DefaultProjectID.description: Default Project-id to use for accepted name, hierarchy and synonymy if more than one is supplied

TaxonomicRank.description: Taxonomic rank, according to the DisplayText field of the code-ENUM

links.description: Links to common names, accepted names, synonyms, hierarchies, the list project and to the list containing this name

DefaultProject.description: Exists only and set to 'True' if there are more hierarchy providing projects available and the current hierarchy is the default one in this list
Exists only and set to 'True' if there are more projects available which provide accepted names and the current accepted name is the default one in this list

DatabaseName.description: The database in which the search was performed

NameID.description: The nameid for which the accepted name was searched

AcceptedNameID.description: The found nameid of the acceped name, usiing the default project, see link 'acceptedname' for a link to the name. This AcceptedNameID is identical to the NameID if the taxonomic name is the accepted name.

DefaultProject.description: Exists only and set to 'True' if there are more synonym providing projects available and the current synonymy is the default one in this list

Projekt.description: Internal short name of the list/project

AgentHash.description: An internal identifier for this agent

AgentRole.description: Obsolet! Not used any more. Use link to 'projectroles'.
one of the rolls the agent has in this project

links.description: Link to the refering taxonamic name
Link to the refering taxonamic name
Project link to the project description in which this name is defined as an accepted name
Link to the name dataset of the synonym

NameID.description: NameID of the current parent or the starting name when level==0

NameParentID.description: NameID of the parent of this entry

TaxonomicRank.description: Taxonomic rank of this parent, according to the DisplayText-code-ENUM in the database

baseNameID.description: NameID of the base name for which this parent query was startet

level.description: Sort order for this parent list. 0 is the starting name, 1 the first parent, 2 the parent of the parent, a.s.o.

links.description: Links to the parent name and the hierarchy defining project
Links to the parent name and the hierarchy defining project
Relations links for the reference, containing roles like author

link.description: referenceRelation links for the reference role and sequence
links to further dataset links citing this reference

ExternalDatabaseID.description: Database wide unique id of the external source

ExternalDatabaseVersion.description: Used version of the external source/database

ExternalDatabaseURI.description: Link to the main page of the service/webpage

ExternalDatabaseID.description: Database wide unique id of the external source

ExternalNameURI.description: URI for the name entry in the external source

link.description: Links to the description of the external source (externalNameHost) and a direct link to the external name (externalName)
